original_title: Non si pu√≤ nulla contro il vento
overview: A series of sequences of landscape shot along a distance of 60 kilometres forms a mosaic of places and points of reference undergoing continuous transformation and which do not exist in our own surroundings. In this video, the bodies are not near or far: they are large or small. The horizons change and no space is independent of the person observing it. Incorporating only memory, the landscape is seen in a variety of speeds and movements applying a corporeal logic to the vision.
title: Can Not Be Anything Against the Wind
